strings.string: RUS_Installation enables you to setup your STB - Antenna, Channel, Satellite, Transponder, CAS, etc
RUS_The Archive allows you to playback or delete the programs you have recorded
RUS_The EPG displays program information in time and date order and here you can record them
RUS_The Channel List provides you with functions such as sorting and editing TV & Radio channel list
RUS_The Media Center allows you to browse and view videos, photos, and music from your storage
RUS_STB Info provides the STB status including product name and number, free disk space, etc
RUS_Return to the screen after hiding the main menu
RUS_Get current weather and weather forecast for thousands of cities around the world
RUS_View your pictures as a slideshow with nice transition effects
RUS_Organize your video content by information associated with the video files
RUS_Organize your music collection by information stored in your music file ID tag, like title, artist, album, genre and popularity
RUS_Add-ons are packages that add features and functions not normally included with the XBMC Media Center
RUS_Most of the Media Center's settings can be configured via the GUI under Settings
RUS_The File Manager lets you transfer, copy, delete and rename files and folders on your disk drive, FTP-shares, etc
RUS_System Info allows you to see your system status
RUS_Check your system resource at a glance
RUS_Set Current Position for East Limit
RUS_Set Current Position for West Limit
RUS_Do you want to stop the channel scan?
RUS_Channel search has failed to complete
RUS_Do you want to delete the selected file(s)?

RUS_The time you entered has already passed
RUS_Sorry, that's an irrelevant transponder frequency
RUS_Set Current Position as East Limit
RUS_Set Current Position as West Limit
RUS_You can setup Language, Video, Audio, Antenna, Satellite, Channel, Time and Date in the First Installation
RUS_Antenna Setup enables you to configure Tuner 1 and Tuner 2
RUS_Channel Search menu allows you to scan channels automatically or manually
RUS_You can add or delete a satellite here
RUS_Here you can add or delete transponders
RUS_Most of STB settings can be configured via the GUI under Configuration
RUS_The Conditional Access System allows you to setup Smartcard configurations
RUS_Do you want to apply the rotation limits above?
RUS_Select the satellite you want to configure
RUS_Select a frequency range sent by the receiver to the LNB
RUS_Select the LNB frequency to the LNB you are using
RUS_When set to 'On', LNBs will be switched between Low and High band
RUS_Select the transponder for the selected satellite
RUS_You can control the movements of the motorized antenna here
RUS_Set the East and West limit of the DiSEqC motor, in order to protect from damage due to obstacles
RUS_Press the OK button to apply the rotation limits for the motor
RUS_Try again after stopping the PVR first
RUS_You have reached the maximum number of\nrecordings allowed
RUS_Recording stopped due to insufficient disk space
RUS_Make media length longer than 30 secs to create a chapter
RUS_There is no configured satellite in the list
RUS_Select satellites you wish to search from

RUS_When set to 'On', new channels are searched from existing transponders and the additional transponders that stored by transponder network however if you set this option to 'Off', only the transponder you selected will be searched
RUS_Select the type of channels you want to search for
RUS_Press the OK button to search channels

RUS_Adjust settings for recording in STB

RUS_Set the output settings for TVs that support HDMI cable
RUS_Set up or change network connections including wireless

RUS_Delete eveything off your hard drive
RUS_Restore the system software to its default settings
RUS_Adjust additional settings for STB including fan speed control

RUS_When set to 'On', the STB automatically start a timeshift recording when a different channel is selected

RUS_Set the pre-recording time for a EPG channel
RUS_Set the post-recording time for a EPG channel

RUS_Press the OK button to connect to the AP you have chosen
RUS_When set to 'DHCP', your IP address will be automatically allocated by the DHCP server
RUS_Press the OK button to save the IP address settings
RUS_When set to 'Automatic', the time and date will be obtained automatically from the channel that you select
RUS_Select a channel you want to set your time and date by
RUS_Set the time zone that will be the basis for the date and time display
RUS_When set to 'Automatic', the system automatically change over to summer time
RUS_Press the OK button to save time settings
RUS_Press the OK button to remove everything in the Media Archive
RUS_Press the OK button to remove everything in the Record Archive
RUS_Press the OK button to erase your hard drive
RUS_Go to First Installation after restoring system to the factory default
RUS_When set to 'On', the system switches to deep standby mode when you press the 'Power' button to help reduce the amount of electricity used

RUS_When set to 'Separated', the Tuner 2 receives its own signal input however it will receive only the channel level currently being received by the Tuner 1 when this is set to 'Loopthrough'
RUS_When set to 'Same with Tuner 1', both tuners are connected to the same signal source
